name: meltingly
content:
meltingly adverb
(SOFT/LIQUID)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a soft or liquid way: The meat was meltingly tender, but the skin was still very crispy. The cookies are meltingly good, and not too sweet.
More examplesFewer examplesServe the biscuits warm while they’re still crunchy on the outside and meltingly smooth on the inside. Bake for about 60 minutes, until the pears are meltingly soft.Roast fennel cooked slowly with pork and apples gives a meltingly delicious combination of flavours.

meltingly adverb
(CAUSING LOVE)
in a way that makes you feel love or sympathy: He was tall and his eyes were meltingly dark. Her voice is one of the most meltingly beautiful in the world. Related words
melt
melting
More examplesFewer examplesThe tenor's high notes were meltingly lovely.She was so meltingly close that he could reach out and touch her. In the slow movement, listen to the meltingly beautiful oboe.
